intro: Oxyacantha chrysocarpa, commonly known as the golden-fruited shrub, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a small, yellowish drupe that ripens in the autumn. It is often grown for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
